oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Typed on a piece of paper taped to the back of the photograph: ''ADL Council leaders meet with Oscar Cohen, ADL's National Program Director, before his address to the League's young leadership group at the Albany Hotel, January 12. Cohen discussed key policy questions coming before ADL's National Meeting in Washington, as well as the University of California Study of American anti-Demitism [sic]. Left to right Oscar Cohen, ADL National Program Director; Robert Adelstein, ADL Council Chairman; Mandel Berenbaum, vice-chairman of ADL's Denver Executive Committee and first chairman of the Council; and Sheldon Steinhauser, ADL's Regional Director, pose together in a hallway during an Anti-Defamation League Catholic-Jewish Dialogue meeting at Regis College in Denver.

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: American, Sadie,--1862-1944

Kahn, Sol G.

Kafiski, Martha
Bair, Adolph--Mrs.
Mayer, Carrie

Diamond, Grace
Brown, Ben
Friedlander, Amelia
Huffman, Alfred
Kahn, Tillie
Rosenbush--Mr.
National Council of Jewish Women.--Denver Section
Jewish women
Jewish men
Social life and customs
Kosher food
Group portraits
Denver (Colo.)
Leadville (Colo.)
Colorado
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Appears in ''Images of America: Jewish Denver 1859-1940,'' by Dr. Jeanne Abrams, page 74.

On front of photograph: ''To the Council of Jewish Women, Denver, Colo. Compliments of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred A. Freedheim. Jewish Picnic given at Leadville, Colo. complimenting Miss Sadie American touring the U.S. organizing the Councils of Jewish Women, July 28, 1895.'' ''See Rear'' is inked on front of photograph. Handwritten on the back of the photograph: ''Souvenir of a Gala day at Twin Lakes, July 28-95. Standing Mrs. Saidi Lands, x, Dr. Sol G. Kahn, Mr. Sol Garrett, x, Martha Kafiski, Mrs. Adolph Bair, Miss Sadie American, Mrs. Carrie Mayer, Alfred A. Freedham, Grace Diamond. In Bus: Bus Driver, Mr. Ben Brown, Amelia Friedlander, x, Alfred Huffman, x, Tillie Kahn, Mother of Sadie American, x, Son of Mrs. Adolph Bair, Mr. Rosenbush, x.'' ''x Deceased.'' Typed on paper attached to the back of the photograph: Contact: Janice Rosen 721-6766. Caption for Photo Accompanying Attached Article for Release June 3, 1988. In 1895 the young organization set out to attract attention to their organization and increase membership. Denver Section hosted a visit from Miss Sadie American who was touring the country to help form new sections. Trips into the mining communities of Colorado were arranged. This picture was taken on an excursion to Leadville.''

A group of men and women in and in front of a horse drawn wagon. Standing in front of the wagon left to right: Mrs. Saidi Lands, Dr. Sol G. Kahn, Sol Garrett, Martha Kafiski, Mrs. Adolph Bair, Miss Sadie American, Mrs. Carrie Mayer, Alfred A. Freedham, and Grace Diamond. On the wagon: unidentified man, Ben Brown (driver), Amelia Friedlander (holding sign), Alfred Huffman, Tillie Kahn, the Mother of Sadie American, the Son of Mrs. Adolph Bair, and Mr. Rosenbush. The group participates in a Jewish picnic at Twin Lakes in Leadville, Colorado. Amelia Freedlander holds a sign that reads, ''This Way Kosher Picnic.'' The word ''Kosher'' is in Hebrew. The Denver Section of the National Council of Jewish Women (NCJW) hosted the picnic to honor Sadie American who was touring the country to help form new sections of NCJW. The Denver Section was founded in 1893, the same year the national organization was established to promote Jewish education, philanthropy, and social reform. The early group of women worked to offer aid and to Americanize East European immigrants at the turn of the 20th Century.

Given to the National Council of Jewish Women by Mr. and Mrs. Arthur A. Friedheim. Arthur A. Friedheim is one of the people in the photograph. National Council of Jewish Women, Denver Section donated it to Beck Archives in December 1976.
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: 1 item (photograph), 8 x 10 inches, black and white

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Handwritten on the back of the photograph: ''June 11, 1916'' and a list of 18 names: ''Harry Kaufman, Maimie Denker, Sam Perotin, Tillie Rudofsky, (blank), Celia Jacobs, Iz Plotkin, Betty Rottman (Alpert), Phil Rossman, Celia Wagner, Joe Melnick, Jessie Bronstine (Sachter), Harry Gibbons, Ann Gibbons, Albert Lenner, Ann Wandel, Dave Wandel, Henrietta Wandel, (blank), Max Pollock.'' ''Donor: Mr. Arnold Alpert.''

A line of twenty men and women are holding Iota Kappa Fraternity pennants and wear hats that read ''I.K.F.'' They are standing at intersection of Colfax Avenue, Cheyenne Place, and Broadway in Denver, Colorado. From left to right: Harry Kaufman, Maimie Denker, Sam Perotin, Tillie Rudofsky, (unknown), Celia Jacobs, Iz Plotkin, Betty Rottman (Alpert), Phil Rossman, Celia Wagner, Joe Melnick, Jessie Bronstine (Sachter), Harry Gibbons, Ann Gibbons, Albert Lenner, Ann Wandel, Dave Wandel, Henrietta Wandel, (unknown), Max Pollock. Behind them is a driver at the wheel of a charabanc. The Smoky Hill Trail/Pioneer Monument and Fountain is visible behind the charabanc. In the background is a tramway car and the Denver Public Library Carnegie building (1910-1956). The buildings on Colfax Avenue include the Franklin Studebaker building and The Stanley Motor Carriage Co. building.
Donated by Arnold Alpert in December 1977.
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: 1 item (photograph), 6 x 14 inches, black and white
